On Thu, 28 Aug 2003, Michael Silverstein wrote:

> > > For a better defense of ET and discussion of the
> > > limitation of automation than I could ever provide, you should read
> > > some of Cem Kaner's articles on http://www.kaner.com/. Note that I
> > > don't agree with a lot of it.
>
> To clarify my sentence above, the last word "it" equates to things
> written on the site about exploratory testing, as well as a lot of
> negatives about test automation.

Funny, you know I am in general agreement with all he's saying about GUI
test automation, and how it's not much use. His problem is that he's
testing in the wrong place. He wants to test if the printer driver gets
the margins correct, and he ends up testing the entire GUI, too. He's
a victim of the "separate the testers and the programmers" method of
development.

If you replace ten difficult GUI tests with one difficult GUI test
and ten easier tests at a lower level, suddenly you find your test
automation has become much easier.

cjs
